name: In-stream habitat complexity
functionStatement: Channel and floodplain structure supply depth, velocity, substrate diversity, and vegetation to support native organisms through all life stages.
descriptionMarkdown: Multiple habitat types (riffles/pools/woody debris) exist if historically expected, not unnaturally uniform.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Count distinct habitat types (riffle, run, pool, cover) along the reach. Use imagery as a screening aid where needed.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Straight, entrenched, uniform channel with little cover.
Criteria: Very uniform channel. Limited structural diversity.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Long uniform glide or sand bed with occasional shallow run.
Criteria: Mostly uniform. Only 1-2 distinct features.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Riffle and run common. Pools intermittent. Sparse cover.
Criteria: Some variety but missing key elements.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Riffles, runs, pools, and large wood recur across the reach.
Criteria: Multiple habitat types well represented.
